review_title: It was a nice place to work

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA II in Raleigh, NC

pros: Community environment, good for recognition

pros: The benefits are pretty good.
cons: If your are a new nurse and want great training; this is NOT the place for you.

review_title: The friendliest hospital I've ever worked in.
pros: The hospital staff (nursing, management, environmental services, radiology, etc.) are very friendly and helpful. The culture is such that people smile when they see you walking towards them, and then once you are within ear reach they say "Hi", "Hello", "Good morning", etc. If you are trying to find someplace and look lost, people will actually walk you to where you are going. The benefits (health, vision, dental, and especially educational) are really good. The Chief Nursing Officer and Assistant Chief Nursing Officer can regularly be seen in scrubs, helping as needed. The culture is one of transparency, where staff are regularly informed of upcoming changes and improvements. Management is very open to suggestions and ideas for improvement.
cons: This is a small hospital, which I really like, but it might not be for everyone. It has always remained very competitive with pay, but I do wish I earned more. ;)

review_title: Management is organized. Training leaves much to be desired.
pros: There are a many benefits available to Duke employees. This would include discounts in home and car insurance.  There are discounts at the outlet malls, cell phone carriers access to venues for hosting events.
cons: Staff members are very rude to each other and this trend is tolerated by leadership. There is alot of favoritism amongst leadership and employees.  National holidays are taken out of your vacation time.

pros: Employees are friendly and become like family, depending on how closely your department works together.
cons: The hospital is going through a number of changes right now: new management; longer hours; more call; removed all incentive pay; the best employees leave and management says to let them go. Recently, everyone was told there would be no raises, then the RNs received a raise much larger than the usual and immediately. It's hard to promote teamwork after that.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant I and II in Raleigh, NC
pros: Felt that I had job security.
cons: Worked in the Duke system for 6 years. Left in November of 2016 to work at another place of employment. My NA I license are up to be renewed by the end of the month but my former manager will not fill the form out. I  worked very hard to get my NA I and NA II License. I hate to see 10 years of hard work lost. Never had any problems with the Duke system until now.

job_title: Certified Surgical Tech in Raleigh, NC
pros: Nice co workers, convenient parking. Most of the surgeons are decent as well. I believe that the people working 'in the trenches' are doing the job because they love it and want to make a difference.
cons: Terrible management, No one listens to constructive criticism that could help the OR, management has favorites and absolutely abuses that favoritism.

pros: there are a few good souls that work there and are there for the patients and really have a good heart
cons: it's become a business, and the good ones are being pulled out and the money minded folks are taken over

pros: The nurses are amazing, small hospital atmosphere, management is very friendly and approachable, cross training for HUC, 2 week orientation if you are new grad
cons: Pay starts at 12/hour, few other positions to transition into, if you are a male you will deal with aggressive sitter cases

pros: My floor had a reputation of having great nurses. That has proven to be true! On days when I am overwhelmed, I am so grateful for the amazing people here. They are helpful, considerate, and kind! I feel fortunate.
cons: none that I can think of at this time
